name: Paladin Hoss

topics.response_text: We were performing a training exercise with one of the Initiates when we were cut off by the Super Mutants.
He's had enough training that he should know that when facing overwhelming odds, a Brother's best recourse is to wait for reinforcements.

topics.topic_text: What sort of exercise were you doing out here?
topics.response_text: Long range recon. We typically do them in areas that have already been swept and are thought to be clear.

topics.topic_text: 100 caps? How much is really in it for me?
topics.response_text: 100 caps is all I can offer you. Take it or leave it.

topics.topic_text: I've heard enough. Let's go get your man.
topics.response_text: Excellent. We will advance forward slowly until we make contact with the Mutants and clear the area in front of the building.

topics.topic_text: I'm sorry, I can't help you.
topics.response_text: What's wrong, merc? Price not high enough? Be gone. This is better handled without the aid of an outsider.

topics.topic_text: Fuck off, boy scout. I'm not here to help you.
topics.response_text: Very well, then. I should have expected as much from an outsider.
Stay on point. We will back you up. It's the least we can offer you.

description:
Paladin Hoss is a 38 year-old Hispanic Male.

A seasoned Brotherhood of Steel paladin currently stationed at the Falls Church chapter. He's responsible for training initiates but despises the administrative duties that come with it, comparing his disdain for paperwork only to his hatred for cleaning latrines. Despite his complaints, Hoss is dedicated to the Brotherhood's mission and shows genuine concern for his fellow soldiers.

Paladin Hoss's Personality: Dutiful yet cynical, Hoss takes his responsibilities seriously despite his constant complaints about the less glamorous aspects of Brotherhood life. He values camaraderie and shows genuine distress when fellow members fall in battle. While he may grumble about orders, he follows them without question and demonstrates loyalty to the Brotherhood's cause.

Paladin Hoss's Backstory: Born to Hispanic immigrants in the Capital Wasteland, Hoss lost his family to raider attacks when he was young. He was found by Brotherhood scouts and taken to the Citadel, where he was raised and indoctrinated into their ways. Hoss proved himself in combat during multiple operations against super mutants and raiders, eventually earning his promotion to Paladin. He's served the Brotherhood for over fifteen years, developing a reputation as a reliable warrior despite his tendency to complain about non-combat duties.
